question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
option1: The National Song Vande Mataram was composed by Bankimchandra Chatterji originally in Bengali
option2: The National Calendar of India based on Saka era has its 1st Chaitra on 22nd March normally and 21st March in a leap year
option3: The design of the National Flag of India was adopted by the Constituent Assembly on 22nd July 1947
option4: The song ‘Jana-gana-mana’, composed originally in Bengali by Rabindranath Tagore was adopted in its Hindi version by the Constituent Assembly on 24th January 1950 as the National Anthem of India
answer: The National Song Vande Mataram was composed by Bankimchandra Chatterji originally in Bengali
explanation: The poem was first sung by Rabindranath Tagore in 1896. The first two verses of the song were adopted as the National Song of India in October 1937 by the Congress Working Committee prior to the end of colonial rule in August 1947. An ode to the Motherland, it was written in Bengali script in the novel Anandmath.
